data.title: Actress Roja Selvamani's Pic From Italian Vacation Viral
data.meta_description: Anam Venkata Ramana Reddy shared Roja Selvamani's picture on X.
data.text:
Actress turned politician Roja Selvamani has grown up successfully in the fields of cinema and politics. Roja, who created a sensation by winning two times as MLA, was defeated in the recent AP elections. She did not come before the media after the election defeat. Roja, who has been active on social media since before, has occasionally shared updates on her account now.

Recently, Roja has once again been in the headlines. The latest photo of her is going viral on the internet. It is said that she is on vacation in Italy with her family. The picture was taken from a distance, featuring Roja in the roadside lane. She was seen wearing a short dress. But she has not posted anything about this foreign trip.

Meanwhile, Anam Venkata Ramana Reddy shared the picture on X. In the caption, he wrote, “Sister Super” with a laughing emoji. As Roja’s photo is going viral, netizens are making various comments. Several social media users are also trolling her.

On the post, a user wrote, “Commenting on their private life is not good sir, that diminishes our credibility, respect one has for you. Let’s try and raise the bar in politics, not lower it by dragging the personal life of politicians in political discourse.” Another wrote, “A good traditional devotee.”

There were also reports that Roja was planning to settle down in her husband’s home state of Tamil Nadu. It is also said that she is re-entering the TV and film industries. But Roja has not said anything on this matter.

She started her Telugu film journey with the film Prema Thapassu in 1991. Roja gained recognition through Sarpayagam, where she portrayed Sobhan Babu’s daughter. Her breakthrough performance came with the Nandamuri Balakrishna-starrer Bhairava Dweepam, propelling her to overnight stardom.

Roja Selvamani further contested on a YSRCP ticket in 2014 and secured victory in the Nagari constituency in Andhra Pradesh. Her political success continued in the 2019 elections and she maintained her position as MLA for the same area. She then lost in the 2024 Andhra Pradesh Assembly elections.
